intro: Mesembryanthemum scabrum, commonly known as the sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. It typically blooms in spring and summer, producing vibrant pink or red flowers. Mesembryanthemum scabrum is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
